doc.name: Rotate2D
doc.description: Rotate a two-dimensional figure based on the angle, and anchor point provided by the user. The angle, step, and anchor points can either be preset in the parameter edit window, or updated dynamically through the actor's ports. The angle can be specified in radians or degrees by selecting the angle type in the parameter edit window. Angles increase clockwise beginning at the positive X-axis in a Cartesian plane. If the accumulate parameter defined in the base class is set to true, any changes to the angle of rotation will be relative to the figure's current orientation. Otherwise, the angle specified will be relative to the positive X-axis.
doc.author: Ismael M. Sarmiento, Steve Neuendorffer
doc.port: The angle the figure is to be rotated by, measured clockwise from the positive X-axis on a Cartesian plane. The default double value is 0.0.
The X coordinate of the point the figure is to be rotated about. The default double value is 0.0.
The Y coordinate of the point the figure is to be rotated about. The default double value is 0.0.
doc.property: The initial angle of rotation. The default double value is 0.0.
The initial x-coordinate of the anchor point. The default double value is 0.0.
The initial y-coordinate of the anchor point. The default double value is 0.0.
How the angle is specified. Can be degrees or radians (default).
